intro: Cynanchum wurdackii, commonly known as the Wurdack's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Cynanchum wurdackii is known for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in its family.
